intro: Thysanotus divaricatus, commonly known as the star-shaped nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that are usually blue or purple in color. These flowers are borne on slender stems and are often fragrant, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and slightly hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
